metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1898 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg 2.x allows remote attackers to conduct cross-origin attacks and readarbitrary files by using the subfile protocol in an HTTP Live Streaming(HLS) M3U8 file, leading to an external HTTP request in which the URLstring contains an arbitrary line of a local file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
